page.title: 06 Villages. FRIETH & SKIRMETT
page.content: FRIETH has grown during the last 150 years from four small settlements - Frieth, Little Frieth, Spurgrove and Perrin Springs. The main part of the village flanks the road and village green. Behind the green are the Church, School (5-12yrs) and Village Hall. To the north is farmland around which ribbon development has linked the original settlements. There are 198 houses and 12 scattered on the common land to the east. St. John the Evangelist Church is a chapel of ease. SKIRMETT straddles the main road. Of the fifty or so houses nearly half are modern having been infilled between older houses. It has a small village hall. The School, closed c1920, a chapel and Anglican Church closed during the last twenty years are now homes. Similarly the Â£Old Forge' and the Â£Old Bakery' are homes.
